tail: SPK. The one who is afraid should not go. 1991a. Akutetaye anakuogopa. NGU. The one who opposes you is afraid of you.

quote: Aliyetishwa na nyoka  usiku akiona kamba hushtuka.
tail: NGU. Someone frightened by a snake is startled at night seeing a rope.
F 3.28; B 1.68; CM 42; KB 23; KA; KS nguruma. Who dares to mock the roaring lion? People often laugh at or mock people in power in their absence, but not when they are present - KA.
RECH. 40. Who will dance to a lion's roaring?

quote: Saa simba anaanguruma hakuna mchezaji, wote huibunja.
tail: AL bunja. There is no dancer when the lion roars, all hole up.
JKP. When the lion roars, all [animals] are quiet.

quote: Chura hupenda maji lakini si maji moto.
tail: EM 40.22. A frog likes water but not hot water. Said if something gets too dangerous.
FSM 40. The monkey is happy when the dog is not there. The monkey likes to play joyfully on the ground, which it cannot do when an enemy is there.

quote: Hakuna mzee atakayesema alikuwa mwoga utotoni.
tail: NGU. There are no senior persons who will say that they were cowards as children.
AL 493. The small kabunda-fish plays in a corner away from the others. A certain kind of person who is afraid to show up in public.
FSM 71. If the monkey laughs it knows that a stronghold is nearby. If weaker persons can laugh in the face of stronger people, it is because they know that help or easy escape is near.

NGU. The thing to fear is fear. "Let me assert my firm belief that the only thing we have to fear is fear itself." President Franklin D. Roosevelt. First Inaugural address, 4 Mar.,1933 (Oxford Dictionary of Quotations).
AL 1439; AL nyoka. Even a dead snake causes fear. One is never careful enough with dangerous matter - AL. Kitumba or mzoga, corpse, remains.
SAM 10.13. Too much fear creates slavery. A timid person is easily misused by others.
JKP. "To be careful is not the same as to surrender" - JKP.
JKP. No use troubling yourself, life has no price. "Time is too precious to be wasted in anxiety" - JKP.

quote: Kuku akila cha ungo anamdharau mpetaji.
tail: AL 964. The chicken that eats from the winnowing basket despises the winnower. One who seduces the wife of a neighbor despises his neighbor and exposes himself to revenge - AL.

quote: Kunguru mwoga hukimbiza madoa yake uchafu
tail: . PM 84. The timid crow avoids soiling its white collar. Don't interfere in matters that don't concern you. Cf. 2006.
F 18.57; KS kunguru. The timid crow withdraws its wings from harm - F.
FSM 60. The timid crab withdraws its claws. A prudent person is careful to avoid danger. Used to give courage to timid persons who do not trust their own ability. Cf. 257.

quote: Kwa mwoga huenda kicheko [na] kwa shujaa  huenda kilio.
tail: F 19.64; H 56; B 3.56; MS 148; KA; MARA 3. With a coward goes laughter, with a hero goes wailing. The coward escapes the war and goes laughing, while the hero goes fighting and leaves wailing and suffering - KA.
NGU. Mourning goes to the brave.

quote: Kwa mkali kwaenda kilio kwa mwoga kwaenda furaha.
tail: FSM.86. Weeping goes to fierce persons, but rejoicing goes to the fearful.
MEM100. One who dislikes peace is always crying. Cf. 2005, 2006.
NGU. What growls/roars does not devour but scares.
MA 304. Fear the one you don't know until you come to know that person.
RSP 38. One who is afraid of the sea does not like traveling. Cf. 2014.

quote: Mcheka bahari si msafiri, na mtaka shari  simwepi.
tail: B 1.38. One who laughs at the sea is not a traveler, and I do not avoid a person who means evil.
T.255; V mchea One who fears to go to sea is not a traveler. Cf. 2010.
KA. A person who is afraid of doing the right thing, doesn't act correctly. A person in order to do lawfully must love the law and not fear it.

person: Sacl. It is useless to count on a person who is impaired - AL.
tail: A 282; SAM 14.7, miba; JK 144; AL 1089. A person who has a thorn in the foot is not a good walker - Sacl. It is useless to count on a person who is impaired - AL. Cf. 51.
. ED 43; JK 145. One who carefully examines the sea is not a traveler. This is said of people who after much preparation suddenly abandon everything. Cf. 2011.

F 25.50; FSM 106; MARA 3. One who hides nakedness [vagina] will never have a child. Often used in reference to greed and stinginess, which are barren in social relations. If a woman hides her pregnancy, she might hurt her child; or, if somebody does not reveal hurts and bothers, that person can not be helped. Cf. 4625.

AL 782; TS 51/15. I'm like the dew, I'm not afraid of my brother-in-law. I conquer my fear of dew, that wets my clothes, I will also courageously encounter my brother-in-law, whom according to custom I must not meet. This is said to give oneself courage to face danger or a difficulty.

. EM m28. A peacemaker must not be afraid of a wound. A peacemaker is one who reconciles two quarrelling people. In doing this, that person may be beaten by one or both of the parties and sustain a wound. If a peacemaker is afraid of being so wounded, he/she should not attempt this task - EM.

quote: Mtembezi mpe mwezi, mpe kiza mwizi.
tail: JKP. Give the traveler bright moonlight, but give the thief darkness.
NGU. A person who walks at night is not afraid of dark areas. Kichaka: dense clumps of trees, the bush.
SPK. The one who was once burnt fears the fire.
SPK. Will the sailor flee from the waves?
KS mwanguo. Don't be afraid of the singing of the mwanguo [bird]. Mwanguo or kipwe, the Senegal bush shrike, a bird with many songs and believed that its singing near a house foretells a disaster.

quote: 2020a. Mwasha moto hahofu taa ya kombe.
tail: SPK. The stoker does not fear the oil-lamp. The person who lights the fires in the ovens and keeps them going is not afraid of the little flame in the dish-lamp - SPK.

person: JK. It is hard to forget one's spurned love and humiliation - SPK. Liwaa
tail: F 35.158; B 1.70; L p.112. One with a scar, don't think that person healed. Instead of usidhani (don't think), usimtaraji (don't expect) is used by AL; KA; KS, kovu and simhasibu (don't expect) by ED 55; JK 132. Mwenye kovu haliwai [na] kidonda. T 382; SACL 477; V 41; JK 132, haliwai donda lake; AL 1416. A person with a scar does not forget the wound. "The wound in the mind remains" - JK. It is hard to forget one's spurned love and humiliation - SPK. Liwaa, liwala, be soothed, quietened, forget. Cf. 50.

quote: Mwenye kukimbia hawazi giza wala haoni jua.
tail: Vkimbia. One fleeing does not think of darkness or feel the sun. Cf. 238.

quote: 2022a. Mwenye kuumwa na nyoka hamaliziki uboka (or  woga).
tail: SPK. The one who was bitten by a snake does not finish being afraid.
SPK. Cowards die while they have not yet died.
NGU. Fear a weakling more than a wizard.
. NGU. Be more afraid of the weakling than of the strong one. Mnyonge, weak, humble, abject, low, debased person.

person: KS. The shy girl will be seduced - SPK.
tail: KA; KStume; AL 1619. The cow that is frightened will be slaughtered. Scrupulous judges condemn a defenseless person - KS. The shy girl will be seduced - SPK.
SAM 20.1; MS 156. Being afraid is also a shield. Cf. 2006.
NGU. Where there are cowards the brave ones are also present.

quote: Pasipo na cha kupoteza, hapana cha kuogopa.
tail: EM p6. When there is nothing to lose, there is nothing to fear. That makes a person free to do or to say what one likes.

EM p11. A scar is easily wounded. A scar bleeds easily. A person who has been wounded spiritually or mentally will easily be wounded again if something reminds him of the experience that caused the wound - EM. Cf. 1870.

quote: Shujaa hufa mara moja. Mwoga hufa mara elfu  moja.
tail: NGU. The brave dies once. The coward dies one thousand times.
KB 287. Courage proves itself in difficulties. Cf. 1755.
V unene. I am not afraid of the thickness of the baobab. It has very soft wood.

quote: Sitaacha kula mkate kwa kuogopa kiungulia.
tail: KA; SM. I won't stop eating bread for fear of heartburn. Don't stop doing a good thing for fear of criticism or slander.
. SAM 23.3. Courage is not the same as fighting someone stronger than you. Running away from a fight is not always a sign of fear.
KB314. [If] you are a leopard, show your claws.
. KS tua. Storm calm down, I've a child at sea. A wish, a prayer.
SAM 25.16. Don't turn yourself into a wash table so that people want to do their laundry on you. Have a mind of your own; don't allow everything. Also used when hospitality is misused - MM.

quote: Usiku wa kiza mangazimbwe: mtumbuu huwa papa.
tail: SACL 483; T 552. On a very dark night, with very poor vision, a sprat becomes a shark. Mangazi-mbwe,dark night. Fig., inscrutable person. Cf. 1847, 1852.
. F 50.47. The face of a fish does not react to the pickle. It remains unchanged by cooking.

quote: Uume ni wa leo na kesho
tail: . B 1.38; T 539. Courage is of today and tomorrow.

quote: Wakati wa hatari, kila mtu hulilia roho yake.
tail: JK 130. In time of danger, all will cry for their own life.
RSP 142. Children, children, they do not fear the fire.

MARA 2; KA. The salvation of a coward is shouting. We should ask for help when we are facing obstacles too big for us. Zindiko, hifadhi, kinga, preserve, protect, save, shield. Kemi, kelele, ukelele, a shout. Cf. 283.
